Package main

Class MyDate

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.MyDate
  • public class MyDate
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Tony Liang

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      MyDate()
      Creates a new default MyDate that uses the current time.

      Creates a new MyDate given the year, month, and day.
      MyDate​(long elapsedTime)
      Creates a new MyDate given the elapsed time in milliseconds.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MyDate

        public MyDate()
        Creates a new default MyDate that uses the current time.

      • MyDate

        public MyDate​(long elapsedTime)
        Creates a new MyDate given the elapsed time in milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - elapsed time in milliseconds

      • MyDate

        public MyDate​(int year,
              int month,
              int day)
        Creates a new MyDate given the year, month, and day.
        • If the year is less than 1970, it will default to 1970.
        • If the month is invalid, it will default to 1.
        • If the day is invalid, it will default to 1.
        Parameters:
        year - year
        month - month
        day - day

    • Method Detail

      • isLeapYear

        public static boolean isLeapYear​(int year)
        Returns if the integer argument is a leap year.
        • If the integer argument is less than 1, it will default to be not a leap year.
        Parameters:
        year - the year
        Returns:
        true if the year is a leap year. Otherwise, false.

      • getNumberOfDaysInMonth

        public static int getNumberOfDaysInMonth​(int year,
                                         int month)
        Returns the number of days in the specified month of the specified year.
        • If the first argument is negative or the second argument is not a valid month (1 - 12), the number of days will default to 0.
        Parameters:
        year - the year
        month - the month
        Returns:
        the number of days in the specified month of the specified year

      • displayTime

        public java.lang.String displayTime()
        Returns the time of this date in hh:mm:ss.
        Returns:
        the time of this date in hh:mm:ss
